links_reviews_text: I love this dress. Just runs a little big. Great with a little white tee underneath. Getting an XS next round - will probably purchase!

Tried it with a tee under, a jacket over, belted, etc, but couldn't find the sweet spot. Mostly just looked like a sack. A cute sack though...
Fits as expected. Petite friendly
Sooo cute I loved the balloon sleeves. Many compliments, ended up leaving in Australia with my friend who also loved it. Paired with white go go boots.
This dress was really awkward on me. It felt like there was so much extra material which made it super unflattering.
Really cute, ran a bit big but overall so cute and I loved it!!
It fit perfectly besides the fact that it was tiny. Basically a shirt. Wish I could’ve worn it to work but it never left my closet. Maybe size up?
was very short and the sleeves were awkward. Also too wide
I don’t know why but didn’t wear and I will wear anything. It was very balloon like and just looked odd
Dress was way too big unfortunately. Understood it was aiming for the flowy look - but it was way too flowy!

links_reviews_title: Love this dress! And bump friendly!
links_reviews_text: I absolutely love this dress! I got so many compliments when I wore it. The billowy sleeves were a little overwhelming because I’m petite but the sleeves were cute rolled up higher on my arm. I sized up a size because I’m 6 months pregnant but I had more than enough room. I may order my true size next month and purchase it!
I love this and it fit great!

I wanted to like this, but there were two problems. The fabric, as others have mentioned, was low quality and very much meant for summer. Should have listened. Also, and this was 100% my fault, I got the petite thinking the length wouldn't matter too much, but it threw all the dimensions off. So word of caution, don't get the petite if you are not petite (duh).

The silhouette of this dress is so flattering and also comfortable. I would have loved to buy it but would never spend that much (even the discounted price) on a casual cotton dress. Good choice to rent, though.
The fabric is a lovely lightweight wrinkled voile and the print is cute. On, me however, the waist was just too high. The belt accompanying the dress was not of the same quality and sat akimbo.

I rented this dress for a weekend girls trip to Nashville and absolutely LOVED it! It was really comfortable, and perfect for the hot temps. The fit is pretty true to size + and the length was perfect.

This dress is not made for curvy girls-The buttons pulled at my bust and right at the crotch. I also have a rather small waist but could not even get the belt on on the biggest loop. Just overall not great for me.
Great pattern, shape and style! Will rent again in the spring!

I feel like this dress was just fine? Fits well, just like the picture. I wore it to work a few times, but not out because it just didn't feel special enough, I think it's cause the fabric is a bit boring? It also wrinkles like crazy. It arrived wrinkled, and it had to iron it before every use because it somehow wrinkled up while just hanging in my closet.
Really like this for everyday wear. Works with tall boots and a sweater/cardigan in colder weather also. A button fell off the first time I wore it, so that was a shame.
Such a cute dress. Didn't have a lot of opportunities to wear it, but I would definitely rent again.
Hard to tell in the photo, but the bottom is sheer. Was not expecting this to be a summer dress.

This dress was sent as an alternative in my box. The material was light and breezy, and definitely good for a summer dress. However, I live up north and couldn't find an occasion to wear it in November. The dress fit well, but I thought the belt was very small. It was uncomfortable to buckle.
Great for the weekend or work!
This was super comfy and flattering. If it’s warm near you then rent this bb, you won’t regret it.
If you have a shorter torso I would skip this dress. It bunches up at the top very awkwardly.
The material on this dress was different than expected, and it did not fit in the hips.

links_reviews_title: Great Fall Transition- Belt is small
links_reviews_text: Great dress and I felt great in it, but the belt's smallest notch was just a bit too tight for comfort so I felt I was holding it all in all day long.

links_reviews_title: Casual but stylish, perfect for day time!
links_reviews_text: Got a lot of use out of this dress - perfect for running around on the weekends. The belt made it feel a bit more elevated -- casual but stylish.
This was so cute and very easy to style up or down.

I love an interesting dress because I can be super lazy with the rest of my outfit. I wore this to work (twice), to dinner, to book club. I always felt very pulled together when wearing it. The sizing is a little weird. The top is pretty voluminous and the elastic waist seemed TTS (maybe a little generous), but the belt was tight.

Wore this on a trip to Seoul-it was perfect for walking around the city and exploring in the humid weather! The only gripe I have is with the belt-it’s cut too small so I replaced with one of my own or went without it.
Ran a little large (but I'm 5'3 and around 125lbs). It looked fine, the sleeves were noticeably large but other than that it was great.
Loved this dress! Fit true to size and was extremely comfortable.
Fits TTS but just looked really frumpy/matronly on me. Maybe because I'm shorter? Not quite sure but not cute :(

I loved this dress! It comes with a belt and small loops for them it to go through, as well as a lining that goes down to the knees. I have a smaller chest so was a little worried about a prior reviewers comment about it being big on top but had no issues and was able to just pull the extra down a bit.

This dress is made out of a lightweight fabric that makes it really fresh and easy to wear during hot days. It fits true to size and comes with a belt that makes it more flattering. I wore it a couple times and made me feel good and put together.

I loved this dress. It fit very well for me though the top could be a little large if you have a smaller chest. Usually I have the opposite problem so it was nice to find a button down style that fit so well. (Note: I also rented the Steele short version of this dress in red and found that one to run smaller than this one.)

links_reviews_title: Beautiful but be sure you have a slip to wear!
links_reviews_text: The cut of this dress is beautiful. It’s hard to see in the pic, but it has a low drop ruffle well below the hip line. The fabric is incredibly lightweight/sheer and the lining is super short. I had to wear an additional slip to feel comfortable.
I loved this dress! I got 2 compliments within 15 minutes of wearing it! My only wish is that it had pockets. But it’s a great dress and super wearable.

This is a really lightweight dress. Fit is great. Nice stretch to the waistband. The only problem is that the belt is too small. I’ll have to wear it with one of mine (which actually looks better), which isn’t a big deal. Can dress this up or keep it casual.
Fits as expected. Petite friendly, nusting friendly. Roomier in the bust
Wish I had sized up to a M. S felt too short to wear without tights. Beautiful color and details.
Perfect dress for the holidays; simple with interesting details.
Wore this for Thanksgiving and loved it. conservative, but a little short so I didn't look like a grandma.

I reeeeeally wanted to like this dress. I had so many plans for it. Work, weddings, dates... I never wore it out of my house. It was already a bit too tight in the waist, and the sleeves were also way too long, so there were fit issues to begin with. But the length was so short it reminded me of things I haven't worn since middle school. I'm 5'2 so I'm not used to having this problem. I kept seeing the gorgeous color and fabric and trying to put it on- I tried tights, i tried tall boots, it was just to short to even leave the house in.
I am short so this was perfect length on me but I would imagine it to be on the shorter side for taller ladies.
This was a top and me and was so small. I don’t recommend for taller, athletic builds.

This dress was very fun and comfortable! I wore it two days in a row at Disney World. I said that it runs small because I am usually an XS in women's dresses and the S fit me perfectly. It is a little short, but I am tall and with tights it was fine. I chose to wear it without the attached sash. Cute dress! Recommended!

links_reviews_title: Cute, but short and lots of fabric
links_reviews_text: Cute dress! Loved the color and the pattern on the fabric, but there was a lot of fabric. It kind of all flows together up top and can be bulky.

Probably mostly my fault I didn’t get use or like this. Ran too short and too ruffle feeling to me. The reviews said short and I just missed it. However, this dress isn’t as ‘drapey’ as I thought...very cottony without knit or something that would allow the frills to hang as they should.
This dress made me look 6 months pregnant. I'm fairly skinny/lean so this was unfortunate. Nice color to it but it just looked awfully frumpy and made me feel chubby.

This dress fit me OK, but it was slightly too baggy and long. I felt like I looked a little too "little house on the prairie". If you're on the taller side this is probably a great pick for you though, as the material and details are really nice.
The ruffles were a little hilarious. It made it look like I had wings lol. But definitely a unique dress to wear!
Beautiful color, but VERY short

This dress was my take a risk item and unfortunately didn't work for me. It was mostly due to the dress not fitting than to any problem with the dress itself. I typically wear petite sizes and since this dress looked to be pretty short, thought I would give it a go. Unfortunately it just had too many ruffles for me and it overwhelmed my frame. The sleeves were way too long, although they are easy to adjust with the elastic band at the wrist. However, the ruffles at the shoulders stuck out too far past my shoulders and were just overall too much for me.

This dress is super cute and the color is amazing. Petite women may find the ruffles and looser top to be overwhelming, but I didn't mind the volume because the waist is cinched and the skirt doesn't flare out too much! The only thing I didn't love was the fit of the waist - it seems like it's cut a bit too short waisted (coming from someone short) and tends to ride up when you move your arms. The belt around the waist is also very loose, so it tends to line up unevenly with the elastic waist seam.

This is such a fun dress--I loved the sleeves, and how the ruffles carry over the back. It would be perfect for holiday parties. Now, when Nuuly says it's a MINI DRESS they are not exaggerating. Only took a star off because it's a little too short to wear to work. It if had been longer, I would have worn it more.

links_reviews_title: Cute but Not the Best Quality
links_reviews_text: This was very cute, but the material was not great. It ran small, I am usually an XS, but small would have been better. Very short. Great color though!
I liked this piece but found it a little short
This dress is pretty cute, but the bell sleeves kept getting in the way. I kept having to push them up in order to do anything.
Good in theory but too many ruffles.
Perfect for work or any day time activity. Color is beautiful.

Loved this dress but like everyone is saying it runs so short! I'm 5'6 and only felt comfortable wearing it with tights. Even then, doing any movement other than light walking is not recommended as you will definitely flash someone. Besides that, the material is thick and a great transition piece for fall to winter as you can layer up or down. My favorte part of the whole dress was the sleeves! I also preferred wearing the tie in a knot at the side rather than a bow if you're looking for other ways to style it.
I’m 5’9 and had to wear it like a tunic, it is very short. Aside from that, nice color and feels nice!
This dress is cute but really short - to the point that I wasn’t even comfortable wearing it with tights. It also was a little too “ruffle-y” for me. Looked a little gaudy when I tried it on.
Super comfy fit really well!

I loved how comfortable the material of this dress was. I wore this to work with black leggings underneath and got lots of compliments. I will say that if you are flat chested like me, the waistband will tend to rise up because your boobs don’t fill up the top of the dress.

I love this dress. I wore it to my BIL's rehearsal dinner and got many compliments. I am only 5'3" and this dress is short but not too short. I was going to order the xs but saw other comments that is short and the S was perfect. I also wore it to work one day and again, lots of compliments.

Just like the eyeshadow palette, this dress is classy, eye-catching, and memorable. I'm a huge fan of long-sleeved short dresses right now and this one is my favorite one I've worn by far. The fabric was a little thinner than I expected, but still very comfortable and high-quality. The ribbon around the waist was kept in place by two loops on either side of the waist of the dress that looked a little unseemly, but I didn't really care too much. I got tons of compliments on this dress and highly recommend it to anyone who wants to wear something unique but classic.

Even though this dress has more ruffles than I usually wear (I'm petite so I have to be careful with too much of anything), I got SO many compliments on this dress! I wore it to host one of my matcha workshops and it was so cute and comfortable! The color is especially pretty.
Beautiful color, very well made, fun cut, awesome dress!

links_reviews_title: Great for dressing up or down
links_reviews_text: This dress is comfortable and has great details; the color is also really pretty. It can be dressed up or down and is great for fall!

I wanted to like this dress, but the top (where ruffles are on the shoulders) took so much adjusting to make it look OK. Then the back stuck out like wings. I have a pretty short torso, so that may have been a big part of the fit for me.

This is one of the few dresses I have ever owned that actually wasn't a midi dress on me! I love the length, as someone who is just under 5 feet tall. For my taller gals, this might not be for you because of the length. It would be more of a tunic!
I wore this dress multiple times because it was so cute and functional!
Super cute, wonderful bright green color, but be forewarned- it is VERY short. I am 5'1" and it was too short for me to wear to work, but if you want a true mini dress, this will work.
It just wasn’t flattering on me.
Love this dress. received so many compliments on it.

If I really wanted to wear this dress out, it would have to be with dark tights or leggings underneath, but I still wouldn’t feel comfortable. If I lifted up my arms or bent over ever so slightly, you could see my butt. For non-curvy girls or petite ladies, this would look super cute and flattering on you. Not sure if sizing up would help my case.
Fits perfect...got a ton of compliments!

I wore this to a trade show and received several compliments. It was a little bit shorter than I would have preferred for a work event (and I'm only 5'3"), so I'd recommend sizing up if you want it to be a bit longer.

Im 5'7" and this was on the shorter side, but not unwearable. I felt comfortable especially since the sleeve and neckline are so covered up, having the skirt shorter didnt bother me. I wore it to work and got a ton of complements on it.

I looooove this dress, but based on prior reviews decided to go with a M when I'm typically between a M-L. I unfortunately wish I would have gotten a L. The dress fits, but as someone with a larger bottom area, it was too short to wear without tights comfortably. It's still pretty warm, so it won't work out for me this month. I definitely would order again in the future and size up to a L.
A little less jewel toned then picture but very pretty dress
Loved the color and silhouette but the ruffles weren't flattering and made me look frumpy.
Fits as expected. Petite friendly. Runs short on taller people
a bit large ...

I rented this in a size large because most UO size medium bottoms don't fit my curvy bum and it ended up being too big, so I think this is actually true to size. The faux wrap style was cute and the fabric is soft - would try again for fall.

links_reviews_text: I’m still figuring our sizing on here. Usually I’m XS across the board on tops but I think because these are pre-worn and washed, I need to size up to a S or even a M on lots of tops. This was super cute and flowy and soft. Loved it! Fit well besides being a bit too small.
I liked this and I’ll wear it maybe once. But the fabric feels like, sooooo stretchy and the shirt is too long for me.
This item is exactly what you'd expect. Ultimately, the pattern wasn't that lovely on me, but wore around the house anyway.

I loved it!! The colors are so fun and youthful. It also has an adorable button embellishment on the shoulder. Though the garment was snug, it still flattered me!

I am so grateful to the honest reviewers that came before me because I knew I had to sized up two sizes for this piece to fit comfortably. I am usually a 2X and I ordered a 4X and it fits perfectly. It is so soft and excellent quality. I am 99% sure I will purchase this one :)
This little sweater tee is super soft and stretchy. I wore it tucked in and got lots of compliments on it. My boyfriend calls me Fruity Stripes when I wear it :)

I was very tempted to buy this! It's a bit longer than I expected, but so freaking cute. I loved wearing it under the Abi Wide-Leg Jumpsuit, as well as another black jumpsuit I own. It's comfy, it's warm but not too warm, it's appropriate for various settings and various temps. A great sweater!
thought this was really cute. softer sweater material, but still thin. loved the unique colors in a timeless design.

its cute! oversized for sure.

I loved this t-shirt, such a great vintage find for a laid back feel. Has a couple holes so can definitely see that its worn in. It didn’t bother me but I could see it bothering some people.
I normally wouldn't purchase a tee at this price but it fits so perfectly and the print and style are rare. Very cute!!! Looking forward to wearing it often!
nothing special about this tee. It wasn't very flattering on me. Wore it tucked into jeans, but still felt kinda like I was wearing pajamas.

I wanted this to be a big baggier and cooler, but I found it tight in the armpits which made the sleeves kinda weird. Would probably look cuter on a person whose a small or medium because then it would be fun and form-fitting.
A perfect vintage shirt - broken in with a cute graphic. Can't beat this.

links_reviews_title: Tight but in the right places
links_reviews_text: I took a risk renting these jeans, but I'm so glad I did! I expected these to either not fit or be too tight to wear, but they were true to size to my surprise. They definitely didn't have any give but that's expected with vintage Levi's. I wore these casually and not to work, so I gave them four stars just for not being as versatile as I had hoped.
I'm always a 29 in Levis - maybe because these are vintage they run small! couldn't button! I ordered another pair of jeans that were 29 and those fit perfectly. definitely size up for these.
Didn’t fit me as well as I’d hoped. I prolly should have sized up. Cute too though.
A little tight around the armpits and the material was very wrinkly and didn't sit right.

I really liked this top in the pictures but was a little underwhelmed in person. The fabric is thicker than I expected and the top is fairly short. I rented for a conference but didn’t end up wearing.
This was the best shirt and definitely considered it buying it ! Wore this to work all the time and received so many compliments.
Wore a few times! Cute, had it for a professional event and it worked well tucked in with a jacket it without. Fits true yo size.
Couldn’t wear because the size was too small for me. Cute top otherwise

I do not understand this top. The neckline was basically choking me and it was loose-ish around the bust but also constrained, and I could not figure out what was going on there. It was hard to choose a size since it was a number and not a S/M/L and so I guess I could try it one size up, but the top isn't sooooo cute that I would jump at the chance to do that.
Very flattering - and unique

links_reviews_title: Great color but the cut was weird
links_reviews_text: I couldn't figure out what bottoms to wear it with because of all the excess fabric in the front. Probably cute as styled in the pictures but I couldn't pull it off.

I really loved this in a lot of different outfits I wore over the month. It paired great with a blazer for work and jeans for a night out. The criss cross detail was very cool and I’d say the only thing that knocked off the Star was that this was just a little too short for me
This blouse was great dressed up for work or down with jeans. Needed to be steamed/ironed every time I wore it, though.
Perfect for travel!
I have a short torso and this ran a little small even for me. Love the neckline though and looks cute with a leather jacket!

links_reviews_title: Cool color and neckline, tight arm holes
links_reviews_text: The arm holes in this shirt were a bit tight on my underarms, and the shirt overall was a bit shorter than I was expecting, but I wore it tucked into high waisted skirts and pants, and I got a lot of compliments!
It was cute for work but baggy at the bottom and didn’t tuck in right. I like the neckline though
very flattering

links_reviews_title: Loved it in the picture, unsure when it came in, fell back in love when I tried it on
links_reviews_text: The fabric is different in real life than the picture. It's heavier and has a texture, which turned out to be good. The weight pulled out any wrinkles. The draping detail that starts at the neck line is gorgeous and the buttons down the back make it fun. It is snug on the neck, so if you don't like turtleneck you may not like this. I loved it, though, especially the color.

links_reviews_title: Nice top, but fit me weird
links_reviews_text: I’m extremely short torso-ed so I got a petite. But then the chest was pretty small (even for me as an A-cup). So it just looked a bit weird on me. The color wasn’t flattering for my pale skin either.

I like this top and wore it to work both untucked with ankle pants and tucked into a pencil skirt. I was pleasantly surprised that the fabric was really different than what I was expecting. I thought it would be a shiny satin, but it's more of a textured, medium weight fabric. I liked that much better, and it drapes beautifully. The color is a deep gold, true to the picture. I wouldn't say this top has any 'wow' factor, but it's a great base piece to build an outfit around. My usual size 10 fit perfectly.
Loved the color and the cut. Knit fabric had some pilling/small pulls and wrinkled easily.
I did like this top--the color is very pretty and the fabric was nice. But ultimately I tried it on and never wore it. For those people in between small and medium, I would get a medium.
I originally bought this as a blouse to wear for work. Although the pic has the top tucked into pants, I loved wearing it over jeans.

The color of this top is adorable! It did run a little large so I suggest sizing down. Material wrinkles very easily so I had to iron before every use. Took this top to London and it worked out perfectly with some high waisted bottoms

Normally I’m a size 8 in tops, but I’d had my eye on this for a while so when only a 12 was available, I went for it. Boy does this run small! Maybe the one I got shrunk in the wash, but it was shorter than expected and fit more like an 8- like UK sizing. Also, with a D chest, it just wasn’t flattering. Wore once and styled with black jeans & long black sweater, but not a keeper by any stretch.

This top is yellow summer/fall transition perfection. I often wore with a high-waste mom jean, and every time I had it on, my hubby was all-you look smokin’ today. I also flipped it and wore it with the buttons in front and it totally worked.
I almost kept this one. Great fabric, great color, great fit. I wore this both to work and on the weekend with jeans.
Wore this several times and will most likely buy it.. cute with jeans or skirt... perfect fit and neckline different and cute!

links_reviews_title: Great fit and lovely bold color - even better in person!
links_reviews_text: Wore this top multiple times, and the size 4 fit perfectly. It looked great styled with black skinny jeans with the front tucked in and with sandals or wedges. Loved the way the fabric drapes in the front and the button details in the back -- overall I found it to be very flattering and versatile!

Fits a little tight in the shoulders/under arm area (uncomfortable at first, but I got used to it and it did not keep me from wearing the top multiple times). I like that it is not see-through at all (did not have to wear anything underneath to keep my bra from showing). Cute, comfy and looks great tucked into pants, shorts and skirts.

Loved the color, the button details and the fit of this top. It was so versatile I wore it a ton for work. Wore it tucked in with a high waisted skirt, untucked with cigarette pants, with a suit, it just worked for a lot.
At first I didn't like this piece but the color with black bottoms really pops. Wore my hair down and always shirt tucked in.
Fit perfectly for my 5'2" 130 lb, 13 year old daughter - she loved it. Styled with jeans.
This is a cute casual top. I would recommend it for a saturday with jeans and sandals.

This top is a really cute flowy piece for summer. It was pretty big on me though (I’m normally an XS/S) and I don’t think even an XXS in this would fit me. It was just a bit too loose. Cute color though!
Pretty and I like the style but it is HUGE like a tent, even though I ordered size XXS.
Cute youthful but bagy and flowy.
Cute, but lots of fabric, not super flattering.
Cute and flattering, easy to throw on over jeans or shorts!
The cut is perfect on this top. It is nice and flowy to hide my middle. bought this!
Definitely should have gone down about two sizes
Adorable top - the arm holes were just really low on me. I wore a sweater over it anyway and it was very cute! I think I could have gone with a 1X instead of the 2X for a better fit!
Even sizing down this was just a sack on me--way too wide and boxy. The fabric was nice, though.

links_reviews_title: Pretty meh. But not even pretty.
links_reviews_text: Simple tank but it was really baggy and worn out. Didn’t look like anything special. Looked like something I could pick up during a grocery run to target, but it looked so frumpy that I wouldn’t even wear it ON a grocery run to target.

links_reviews_title: Super Cute, But a Bit Big
links_reviews_text: This tank was super cute - but it did run a bit big. I was afraid to size down but the reviewers were right. I still wore this though - and still loved it.

links_reviews_title: I wore the heck out of this shirt
links_reviews_text: I looooved this shirt. So easy to throw on. The color is so cute. I literally wore it everywhere - to work, on the weekends, to a party, etc. I'll definitely order this one again in the future
Wore many times on my trip to Florida great for day and threw a jean jacket over at night
Cute top. The arm holes were a little big, but perfect for a sweater over it. Great for what I wanted.
I would have worn this more if I'd ordered it in the spring or summer rather than December but I wanted it for a trip to Florida I went on and don't regret it. Super cute!
Usually I'm a fan of an oversized tank but there was too much fabric especially when I bent over for my liking. Pretty color but just didn't work well for me.

links_reviews_title: Bump friendly top for everyday wear
links_reviews_text: At 22-26 weeks pregnant, I ordered my pre-pregnancy size of this tunic top (XS) and it fit great. The length is great for covering the maternity panel in shorts or jeans, but I would love it all the same without my bump.

Love this top. It's big and drapey (which I happened to love), but definitely size down. I'm usually a M or even L, and in this a S fit perfectly. I wore it with jeans and jean cutoff shorts this summer and it was one of my favorite looks. Nice and long, and I love this color.
I expected the shirt to be oversized but I should've sized down. I love the color of the shirt but it was unflattering on my large bust.
I wore this tunic to a variety of places; with jeans, slacks, jacket.

Loved this top! Went with jeans, khakis, black fitted pants or leggings. I wore this piece the most because it was so practical! Ran very large for me since it balloons out but you can do a front tuck if you want. I’m usually a M but got a XS.
Loved this top! It could be worn around the house or out to dinner. Highly recommend to anyone!
This was a super easy wear. I sized down based on the style and other reviews and would highly recommend it
Runs big so def size down. Would order again!
Loved the color and style .. ran large, esp in arm holes but I would maybe get it in size smaller next time
Fit oversized as expected. Super cute! Fairly long, as pictured.
Loved this top!! Perfect for a casual day at work
This shirt is adorable! The color and shape are super flattering.
I wanted to love this- the color is amazing and so is the style! Just not on the girl w curves- made me look pregnant unfortunately 🤪
The color and fabric are gorgeous! It was a bit too much fabric for me.

I am between sizes M and L, and opted to go with the L since it is a flowy style and would look fine if it was a little oversized. It was a tad big on me, moreso in the arm holes, but to be expected for the size I ordered. I felt that although it was more fabric, since it was lightweight it didn't seem to make me look bulky. I wore with shorts and jeans and looked great paired with all! Loved the dusty color, and was perfect for summer, but would look great layered for Fall too!
Really soft comfy top, and in a beautiful color. But, it was just too much fabric for me, and pretty long too.

I really wanted to love this tunic. The color is a very attractive dusty rose and I like the length but it really swallowed me up. I may try a smaller size but I’m concerned about the fit across the bust.

Loved this trench vest! I primarily wore it layered over jeans as a vest with a long-sleeve underneath. I tried wearing it as a dress once, but there isn't a fastener below the belt and I am more pear-shaped, so leggings were a must as it gaped in the front. The color was definitely different from what the photo looks like – I would said it's closer to an army surplus/green instead of the brown tone the images look like.
This one didn’t transport well. It looked frumpy on. Not for me!

links_reviews_title: Very cute but also very thick material
links_reviews_text: Very cute but also very thick material, which is normally a good thing but it was just a little too much for my small frame. I wanted to style it but it just didn't fit as good as the model.

I think I would have bought this were it less expensive ‘cause the idea is sophisticated, but it needs some tailoring to actually fit (and my body shape was a fit model for this exact brand, proportionally). The top is too wide/loose to lay how it should while the wrap-around rest is too tight to not splay time the sides a bit. It also wrinkles like crazy, so not meant for an occasion in which you sit much.

I loved this vest! I wore it over a black turtleneck and got lots of compliments. It is pretty long so I wouldn’t recommend for shorter friends. The only downside of this piece is that it wrinkles easily.
Wore it over a black turtleneck, very stylish!
Super easy and cute
Liked the idea of this piece, but when I put it on was not a fan. The shape of the lapels sat weird, and the material wrinkles very easily. Wanted to love it.

While I loved the concept of this trench vest, there were some sizing and technical issues. First of all, I should have sized down at least one size. This vest didn’t lay on me properly because I was swimming in it. Second, for it being so large, I was surprised at how short the belt was - it should have been at least 4” longer. Finally, the quality wasn’t worth the price tag. I wore this once and lost one of the buttons on it (and was not doing much physical activity). Wouldn’t closet again.
Nice color but too large for me. The lapels enveloped my frame.
Wore it several times - bought the item!!
Great layering piece, looks really chic. Fabric is heavy duty.
I wanted to wear this to work so bad, but COVID-19 hit and I didn’t get an opportunity. I may order again in the fall.
I wore this to work with different earth toned sweaters. Loved the fit. I was surprised it felt so well. I have a hard time with pencil skirts but this was perfection.

Based on the pencil cut and plaid print, I expected the material to be a more structured, like dress-pants and other work-appropriate pencil skirts I own. Instead, this is pure stretch fabric, like a body-con dress. The waist fit perfectly, but the belt seemed at least 2 sizes too small. The whole thing made me feel like I was trying for the wrong kind of attention. I can't imagine a different size would help. Probably only appropriate for straight body types.

links_reviews_title: A little tight, but still cute!
links_reviews_text: I ordered this skirt in my usual size (8), and while it fit, it was definitely a little snug! It wasn't tight enough to prevent me from wearing it, but I probably would have liked it more if I went up a size. One thing I really really love is the material. I tend to not love how pencil skirts look on my hips/lower belly, but this material was thick and structured enough that it didn't show every single lump and bump.
Ver flattering - makes stomach look flat. Also high quality material.

links_reviews_title: Not good for straight body types
links_reviews_text: This was just Mleh. The belt adds bulk to the mid section so unless you obvious hips and a narrower waist it’s just not flattering.

This is great for work! The length was great for petites and hit just at the knee for me, while still being high-wasted. It does run a little snug in the midsection but with some shaping wear this is a really great skirt.
Size up and it’s amazing! My hip is around 36 inch and 8P fits me well.

I wore this for a divorce court date (I know, super fun right?). It was exactly what I was looking for, appropriate for that setting but also made me feel confident and trendy. My son also had a doctor's appointment that day and his pediatrician asked me where I got it because she loved it :)

links_reviews_title: Snug for chicas with bigger booties
links_reviews_text: Not meant for you if you have a large booty! Pulls at the buttons
Would have loved this for the office but it was too tight. Size way up
I loved this skirt. High waisted, slim- yet flattering for an hour glass shape. Forgiving on my large behind.
The skirt fit really nicely and I got a lot of compliments. Perfect for work meetings

I wore this with a white sleeveless blouse and a gray cardigan with black booties - maybe better with some Mary Jane pumps. Gave me old school, mad-men secretary vibes but I think if I styled it with a sweater like the picture, I would have really vibed it. Cute but wasnt wasnt wearing it the most in my rotation.
If you’re apple shaped or carry any weight in your tummy, this will not flatter. Or you’ll need to pull out the shapewear to make it work.
Fit me like a glove overall, but the proportions were not right for me. Material is heavy, which I enjoy in a skirt. Hits below the knee... not my favorite length of skirt, but still cuuuute.
I normally wear a size down. Glad I ordered the next size up. Got lots of compliments.

It seemed like a good idea... the belt did not fit the skirt when it was on. I could blame it on my muffin top but I don't think the sizing is accurate. I am a 12/14 and ordered the 16 to be safe and it was SNUG.
This is high quality and super cute for a more conservative vibe. Paired with loafers and a sweater.
Skirt is really nice and versatile, but was tighter across the hip area than expected. Would recommend but size up
A little right over my pear-shaped hips but so well made and chic. Loved it for fall.
Ordered my normal size that fits me in other styles - Way too tight for me. couldn't wear.

links_reviews_title: Cute idea, not perfect on me
links_reviews_text: The waist was a bit too big, which is usually the opposite for me, so I ordered a 12 maybe too conservatively. Tightening the belt made the fabric bunch weirdly around the top. Had a little room below the hips, too, around the tops of my thighs. I'd maybe try it again in a size down. Got some compliments, and fortuitously had the perfect sweater top to match.
Too tight
Really nice if you're looking for something cute but a little conservative. Loved the pattern. Wish there was a teensy more structure and more holes in the belt, but it was good.
If you have wide hips, the 32 is a big tight in that area. But nice and stretchy otherwise.

Very comfortable jeans! I probably could've gone another size down since they stretched so much but they still fit. A little faded and not so pure black but that could have been because they were washed a few times. Wore at least twice a week!
Stretch denim but it held its shape. Great for looking put together while running around with the kids.
Very comfy, very cute, big fan. Totally agree with other reviews that they look like they're not going to fit because they're so tiny, but they stretch a lot.
These were amazing! I wore these so often, the color was perfect and the fit stayed right even after a few wears. Definitely renting these again so I can buy them and keep them forever.
Very versatile piece. Can be dressed up or dressed down.
Fit beautifully, only wish the wash was darker
Love these, fit great and you can dress them up or down. Only issue is they were a little faded from washing, but still wore them 2-3/week.

links_reviews_title: Never wanted to take these off
links_reviews_text: I ordered a couple of sizes too big because I was nervous about the sizing turns out I should have stuck to my size because they were kind of baggy on me but outside of that I loved these so much. I'm tempted to go two sizes for my next order and potentially buy them so I can have them forever.

links_reviews_title: So good, had to purchase them!
links_reviews_text: These are the best jeans I’ve ever put on! I HAD to keep them! I got a size 28p and the length fits perfectly and The waste is so stretchy and comfy but appears to fit like a glove. Win win. Must have!

These jeans are wonderful. I love the stretch and thickness. They are quite comfortable. I was skeptical about the ultra-high rise style, but they turn out to look pretty good. They do slip down a bit, but not too bad.
The sizing is wayyyyyyyy off. I sized down two sizes and they were still big. Don't recommend.

I was definitely tempted to keep these. They fit super well. At first they felt like they might be too tight but once they were on they were a dream and very flattering. I'll probably rent them again at some point!

links_reviews_title: The most perfect jeans on earth
links_reviews_text: Stretchy, comfy, stylish ... what's not to love? The petites fit like a dream. Obsessed.
I liked them overall, but probably wouldn’t order again or purchase. Nothing super special.
Too much fabric in the crouch. 5'7 155-160lbs and maybe a 28 would have fit better.

links_reviews_title: Comfy, great stretch, easy to wear
links_reviews_text: For me this was a tad too high waisted for me, but they are true to size, great fit! I recommend them
These were great jeans. I would order again.

links_reviews_title: Stretchy and form fitting in all the right places
links_reviews_text: These jeans were the material you want all jeans to be - quality denim with the proper give that still hold their shape. I wore these from work to night, styled them up with thigh high boots, heels and sneakers. I chose the petite and they were just above my ankle - the perfect length in my opinion, couldn't have been happier with the selection.

Super cute and comfortable jeans/leggings. They're pretty stretchy. Only downside was that lint would REALLY stick to them and it was hard to get it off. But otherwise they were good for a concert that I went to
The jeans would’ve been great if they fit! I’m in between a 27 and 28 and the 28 were too big
I loved the fit and feel of the pants, but lint stuck to them immediately and all over. Just be sure to have a lint roller handy!
Great fit and really comfortable to wear
Love, love, love this item. I've rented it multiple times and should just gift it to myself because it fits so well. Super cute and pairs well with a lot of different tops.
So cute, but it's pretty tight around my waist and the straps are long considering I ordered a petite.
I like the butter soft denim of this jumpsuit. The straps are too long and can not be adjusted. I think you need a long torso to pull this off.

I sized up in this jumpsuit from an 8 to a 10 and the fit was pretty good. It was definitely a little tighter around my midsection. The straps were too long so I knotted them in the back. It definitely accentuates the hips and cuts off height. Not my favorite.
The straps were too long for my short torso. Great outfit for someone else.

links_reviews_title: I could have gone swimming in this
links_reviews_text: This was the largest petite I have seen in a while. I would be willing to bet the model shown has this pinned up in the back. The straps were SOO long and there were no further buttons to adjust with which is too bad as that may have solved the issue. Unfortunately I never wore this. It looked ridiculous.
I got compliments every time I wore this item. Super flattering. Cute cropped, wide legs and fitted top. Will def rent again!
I freaking love these pants. Maybe a smidge big, but I wouldn't quite dare to try a size smaller. They are adorable.

I did not have the body type for this. I have wider hips and these made me look like I have a really loooong rear end. The part over the chest looked really small on my bust. I wasn't a fan. On the right body type, these would be really cute I'm sure.

Super cute and comfy. Nursing friendly too! Great for moms who are running after toddlers. Multi seasonal - I wore it in warm and cool weather since we went out on a trip. Lots of compliments! Will definitely be purchasing this one.

links_reviews_title: Cute but not quite my thing
links_reviews_text: I did like these overalls but I didn’t love them. I think, mostly because I’m short (5’1”), the wide legs just didn’t look super flattering on me. They did fit and looked and fit pretty much as advertised in the pics. It was a fun piece to rent but didn’t wear as much as I thought I would. Might look better on a taller person.
Really wanted to love these, but it just didn't fit in the hips and the straps were too loose.

Really liked it! I’m 5’4” and got the petite. The length and leg was great but the straps were still a bit big. You can adjust them but still too long. I don’t think it took away from the look. Super cute and shockingly comfy!
I really loved the style of this, but it was a bit too tight in the hips so you could see the fabric pulling across. The straps are also a bit long if you're on the shorter side, like me.

links_reviews_title: Love these overalls! Adorable, comfortable, and fun to wear!
links_reviews_text: I wasn't sure how I would like these, but I ended up wearing them a ton. They are fun to wear and they fit perfectly on me. If you're on the fence about wearing an overall, go for it!

I am an overall lover, and these were really fun! As someone with a larger bust, the top part was a bit small, but then the straps were too long even on the shortest loop. I still wore them several times, but weren't as comfortable as they might have been.

links_reviews_title: So cute but straps are incredibly long
links_reviews_text: Loved this so much and might try to make it work with safety pins but the straps are not nearly adjustable enough for the petite size. Like probably 6 inches too long.
Super cute and comfy. The fabric has give to it so I wish I sized down. The straps are adjustable but too long so if you can size down do it!
I wore these every chance I got...until the button fell off. The straps were a little long for me.
Super adorable but the straps are too long. If I owned these I’d make more button holes.
Loved these so much! perfect fit, light weight, cute style! Cannot say enough how much i loved them. Even my husband was a huge fan. Got tons of compliments at work too.

links_reviews_title: Cute, but not the best fit for tall gals
links_reviews_text: I was swimming in my normal size when I tried these on in store, so I went 2 sizes down. Probably a mistake, because they ended up being too short in the torso, even after I adjusted the straps to the longest button. They also stopped higher on my calves than I'd like. That said, they were super comfy to wear around the house.
Not all overalls are made equal but these were really flattering! Size up if you have a long torso like I do.
Nice to go to pumpkin patch
Perfect sweet piece. Felt like this one had been worn a few times
it's cute!
Loved these, but in retrospect, not the most flattering on my less than flat post-baby belly...
The bottom half fit and was cute. But the apron top was way too big/baggy. I tried making the straps tighter but it did not get nearly as tight as I needed.

I tried to buy this from Anthropologie a few weeks ago, but this size was sold out! So happy I got to try it after all! I wore this with another top from Nuuly, and I’m in love! They’re super comfy, and fit true to size. I didn’t want them too baggy, but maybe size up if you do. I feel very Donna Sheridan from Mamma Mia—in a good way!
Bit of an odd fit, but adjustable straps make it work. Didn't love, maybe too cutsie for me and my build
Overalls are always a good idea. I brought these on a backpacking trip to Germany and I was able to dress them in so many different ways. So happy I rented these!

links_reviews_title: Very versatile, became a staple in my closet
links_reviews_text: Wore it each time with a tighter white or black shirt because the legs are pretty loose fit. Fits nice around the waist and the straps weren't too long or short. Wore it at work and while traveling, very versatile.

So cute but just was a little too tight for me to wear. I have trouble at times because I'm so straight up and down but also very muscular so this was a case where the waist was too tight but the hips were perfect. It's so cute though and don't think it's ill fitting, just not the right fit for me!

links_reviews_title: Cute and creative take on overalls!
links_reviews_text: These overalls are great and can be dressed up or down. They fit true to size and would only possibly be tight in the waist area.

links_reviews_title: My New Found Love of Overalls
links_reviews_text: I have not worn overalls since I was probably 7 or 8.... and I've tried to wear overalls in the past but found they fit me weird or made me look like I was a little kid again. These fit me great though! they are high-waisted, which is perfect. The only tricky thing is the adjustable buttons are in the back. They are comfortable and the fabric is soft and beautiful.

links_reviews_title: COMFY but a lil too big
links_reviews_text: This is so comfy and great material. I’m trying not to wear this every day. Just ran big. I’m curvy and got a 31 which is my normal size and it was very very loose. Still worked but definitely will rent this again in a size down! Loved!

I'm new to motherhood and find myself dressing more like my toddler. This fit the bill. Utilitarian enough for rolling around on the carpet but trendy enough for our one outing a day. I think I have a long torso but the straps are adjustable. Super comfortable, easy to throw on and go.
The belt helped slim my perma-mom belly, and I got so many compliments I'm going to keep it. I used my steamer on it after using up the whole bottle of wrinkle spray, and that made it look nice.

links_reviews_title: Very cute just too big for me
links_reviews_text: I followed recommendations to size up but that was not necessary
Sooooo Flattering and fun!!! Love love love everything about this dress. Will definitely rent again.
I wore it on a vacation as well as at a casual party. Got a lot of compliments.
Super cute and fun dress. The fit was perfect for me in the Petite. I wore it with black wedges. Wrinkles easily.
I’m 5 feet tall and it was the perfect petite length. I paired it with short black booties and hit brunch with my girls and got lots of compliments.
Love this dress, I got tons of compliments in it and felt like a total bad ass. Love polka dots!! The only problem was I ripped one of the slits because I am a total clutz.
Very classy

links_reviews_title: Runs a bit small, but still loved it
links_reviews_text: This was THE dress for plus size influencers earlier this season, and I can see why! It’s such a gorgeous dress. It does run small (I’m an 18/20 and the 22 fit me) and it was a little too cold to get great use out of it, but I wore it in LA and or was a hit. Love this one, for sure.

Gorgeous but modest, the fabric is a slightly heavier material perfect for fall. It does run a size big, but if you size down you’ll love it. Also worked great with my larger boobs, plenty of room up top!
I received countless compliments in this dress. The only thing I didn’t like was how puffy the sleeves were.
This dress fit like a glove. The length was perfect and the off the shoulder part stayed in place.
I will definitely try a larger size of this dress. If it had fit I’m sure I would've loved it.

This dress is really lovely! It's not quite as casual feeling as I had imagined, but if I had a nicer occasion to wear it to during my rental, I would have definitely worn it. The bodice itself was quite tight — I'm usually between a 20 and 22 so ordered up a size and still felt it ran a bit small.

links_reviews_title: If you're shaped like Dolly Parton, this Dress is for you!
links_reviews_text: I love this brand, and the clothes are made so well. Maeve always has interesting twists. For example, this has a removable belt, and a defined waist. The dress looks great on, if you're having a skinny day. I had a meatball sandwich for lunch and didn't like my profile afterward haha. It was big on top for me, and tight around the tummy (after lunch). But very festive for October! I topped it with a black leather Moto jacket, fish nets, and black studded booties.

Oh my god I love this dress. I almost bought it but I'm in the midst of changing my diet for some health reasons and didn't want to buy something that might be too large in a couple months. Wore it to the movies, to a wedding, to an audition, and more. Would definitely get again and maybe buy if I'm at a static size.

Decided to try this because it was outside my comfort zone but untimely when I tried it, it was still outside my comfort zone. The silhouette is a bit too prairie for me. Love the pattern, and color. The fabric seems to wrinkle though.

I wore this dress to an art opening and a comedy show. Wherever I went, I felt cute and people couldn’t stop commenting on how much they loved the dress. I read somewhere that this is the dress that looks good on EVERYBODY and I can’t agree more. I wish I had even more fancy events so I could wear this even more. Get this dress—you won’t be disappointed!

I was really surprised how much I liked this dress. It’s the perfect length for my 5’4 height. I liked how the dress made my waist look tiny and the puffy shoulders. The color is more of a rust brown than a reddish color in the photo but it’s still beautiful. Highly recommend.

I had tried the size 14 in the store of this dress. It felt a little bit too fitted in the hips for my liking. So I went ahead and rented a size 16. The hips were tailored the same in the size 16. But the bust and sleeves were much too big. I prefer the 14. Where I could wear the sleeves up on my shoulders or off my shoulders. Size 16 I could only wear off my shoulders. Hope to be able to purchase a size 14 eventually. I got a lot of compliments. It’s a very cute style.

To say this is my favorite dress would be an understatement. Everything about this dress is dreamy and I'm highly considering purchasing it. Wore it twice-once at work and once to a convention-and received so many compliments. This dress does require some ironing/steaming but is extremely flattering!

This dress is so cute on! The fabric is thicker and does crease- I absolutely had to iron it. I'm really glad they had it in petite- it hit right at might ankle and I wore it will some wedges and it looked great.
Looks like on the picture. Good dress.
I wore this dress for a wedding. It was very pretty and I got lots of compliments

This dress was very cute. I dressed it up with heels and wore it to an interview and then down with a denim jacket and flats for brunch with some friends. On me, the neckline was too small, so it didn’t fit quite right. The pleats on the bust were too high but if I’d gotten a bigger size it would have been too long. May work better on someone shaped differently
Wore it to a wedding, such a fun and easy/comfortable dress!
I love this dress. I felt great in it and it was also comfortable.

Beautiful embroidery and very classy, but the fabric looked worn out on the one that I got. The fit was good, if a little tight in the shoulders (but I have more broad and muscular shoulders/ arms). The fabric is light and airy--I probably would have worn it in the summer, but as it was I didn't wear it out in the winter.
Got lots of compliments. Wore it to work with a red blazer.
I wore this to a fundraiser and felt great in it. The embroidery is fun and the fit was good.

links_reviews_title: True Midi in the Petite Size
links_reviews_text: This dress was gorgeous and very flattering on a larger bust with a small frame. It had ample room for the "top half." I chose this to wear to a company holiday party and it did not disappoint. I also think I may try this again when the weather is warm because you can wear a razorback bra with it too!

links_reviews_title: Love the fabric/embroidery but WAY too small
links_reviews_text: I sized up based on other reviews and this was still unwearable. It was way too tight in the chest and the neckline was choking me.

Wore with nude heels to a gala (until my feet got tired). Shoulders cut in so this demands a racer-back or strapless bra. Ordered a petite and it hit mid-calf as I expected. High-quality stitching details on the upper section. The skirt was a little wrinkled in transit so I had to iron it, which was simple. I highly recommend this dress! I received a ton of compliments and my boyfriend liked it so much that I ended up purchasing.
This dress is stunning in person and so comfortable on. It's soft and flowy and the embroidery is lovely. Easy to dress up or down

Wore this to a gala and it was way too casual for the event. Additionally, the gala was in November, and the material is much lighter than it appears in the image. The fit overall was good - though a little snug in the top section. The top also didn't lend itself to wearing a bra with straps, as they were visible. If you're going to an event in the spring or summer, I would 100% say its a good find, just get some pasties!

Wore this to a wedding with navy suede boots - got lots of compliments. The embroidery is lovely and I like the way it twirls around the sides of the dress. I may buy this - but I'm not sure how often I'd wear it. Pondering this for awhile - but it's a great dress!
I received many compliments on this. The embroidery is gorgeous. It fit like a glove.
Awesome dress - rent it for a special occasion or just because! It was lovely on and I received lots of compliments

links_reviews_title: True to picture but not as expected
links_reviews_text: This dress was completely different in person than I had imagined. The pictures are accurate but the real thing was way too long for me (I'm 5'3") and you'd have to be as tall as the models in the pictures for this to be an attractive length. The embroidery also stands out more in person, is more ornate than the pictures let on, and I just felt it was too much. The fit was accurate and would look nice on someone taller
I thought this would be a little more free flowing under the chest but it was pretty tight. I felt uncomfortable with my stomach showing the way the dress displayed it.

I think for this dress to look its best you’ll need to have bigger hips. My body is athletic/straight and I thought it looked okay but the dress also ran straight down with me but it didn’t look like it was supposed to do that. Either way I wore it to work and got tons of compliments that day because of the embroidery design! It really is a beautiful dress
The dress was really pretty, but it was a little tight for me in the shoulder area.
Can be worn with flats or with heels. Very pretty, elegant, and it's beautiful without showing off everything.

I love the look of this dress with the embroidery, color, etc. But I found the top of the dress to be tight which made it slightly uncomfortable. I am not particularly well endowed shall we say so I think if you are this might not work for you.
Fit Perfect!!!
I liked this dress, but it was a little oversized in the waist area so I only wore it once. The embroidery is really lovely and the fabric is subtly striped for a unique look.
This was pretty, but it just didn't fit me great. I am probably a bit too large for this style.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful details; a real show stopper!
links_reviews_text: This dress was perfect. I am short, so midi dresses make me nervous, but the Petite sizing was the perfect solution around the fear of an awkward length that I had! The embroidery is detailed, careful, and unique- very vivid colors that really pop against the navy. I wore it first to a wedding with super fancy, sparkly shoes. Then, I paired it with an eight-year-old, bright blue sweater from Urban Outfitters for work (I am a teacher). It was super versatile and I received so many compliments. Highly recommend!
I wore this dress for a rehearsal dinner. The embroidery is so pretty! Perfect with heels, like the model photo!

Overall, very cute and the embroidery detail was nice. The fabric has kind of a tone-on-tone plaid detail. I felt it looked a bit matronly on me, probably just an odd length on my frame, but I got several compliments on it. I was comfortable in my normal size.

Such a gorgeous dress which was perfect for my anniversary dinner! Hits the mark in all the right places for a woman with curves! Only vice is the material is very fragile, seemed to pick some on embroidered bodice.
I wear it to work and got sooo many nice complaints. It fitted great. I loved the embroidery and the airiness of the dress at the bottom.
cute dress wore it to work, very tight on the chest area (I'm a 34 DD), but dug into my shoulders the way it was cut.

links_reviews_title: Pretty embroidery. Runs a bit tight through the chest.
links_reviews_text: I wore this with a bright beaded cardigan to work.

links_reviews_title: Not for the petite & well endowed
links_reviews_text: Dress was pretty but didn't work for me.
Great dress, it's classic but the almost racer back bodice keeps it fresh.
Flowing comfortable gorgeous dress. Can worn be styled up for the office or casual with a denim jacket. Saying goodbye to this one will be hard.

the fabric was pretty and the dress was well-made but it was a bit conservative for my taste. Even with the waist cinched it still felt frumpy to me. I wore it with a sweater for Thanksgiving and still got at least one compliment. It felt too conservative to wear out to dinner and too fancy to wear during the day.
This dress is fun to wear, and attracted compliments. Recommended for the office or a shower!
Love the fabric- travels in a suit case well. Pulled it right out and worn it. Nice and modest neckline for larger cup sizes.

Gorgeous pattern, silk-like textile (it's 100% polyester). Flowy, comfortable dress. A little too wide, though, which caused it to gape out on the sides above the self-tie string belt. No worries, though, because that was covered by my black leather moto jacket. Tried this with ankle boots, but I wasn't feeling the contrast against my ghost-white legs so I switched to 2.5" black cone-heel pumps. Might wear the dress again with tights and boots when the temp outside is no longer 90 degrees.
This dress has a lovely pattern and material. The issue is fit. It’s about 2 sizes too large. The material also stains easy even if you get water on it.
Nice fabric, but it was really very formless.

links_reviews_title: Wanted to love it, ran HUGE
links_reviews_text: I wanted to love this dress, but unfortunately it was huge. I recommend sizing down in this dress. The colors and fabric are lovely but it literally fell off of me.
I loved the dress! I wear it to work. The fabric was so soft, airy and it fit great.

links_reviews_title: Elegant and comfy; it's like wearing silk pj's to work!
links_reviews_text: So cozy, comfortable and stylish. Love this dress!
I loved the shape, but the material was faded and a little stiff feeling to me. I didn't wear it.
I love this dress. It did run a little small on me around the shoulders and sleeves. (That's the reason for four stars). I might give it a try again by sizing up.

Fabric was a nice weight and it fit well. There is elastic at the back, which is especially helpful if you have a booty. It did seem like the dress had been washed and worn a bunch of times though, the fabric was a little faded.
This was great. The material is very heavy, which makes it feel sturdy and well-made. I would feel comfortable wearing this almost anywhere too, from work to parties. I loved the tiger print too.
Very cute and comfy. Wore it for the College Championship game. Everyone loved.

I didn't order this garment, it was a substitute in my subscription. The print is not my style, but the dress fit very nicely and material was great quality. Had it not been tiger print, I probably would have worn it and loved it!

I wore this primarily to work and it was great for that! The length hit me just above the knee so it was totally appropriate, but the print added something fun! This dress fits true to size and tie waist makes it easily adjustable. If you are petite though the length may be past the knee so keep that in mind.
This dress is so cute and comfy! Doesn’t pull at the buttons like most buttondown dresses, the material is thick but moveable and the length is just right.
I LOVED this dress. The structured material held shape throughout the work day, without looking wrinkled or disheveled. Really cute!

I’m currently hiding my new mom body behind prints and good fabric. This dress achieved both, only knocked a star because the one I received is starting to look a little more vintage than new. Not a bad look but not polished like the photo.
Loved this dress. Fits great and many compliments.
I wore it for wine tasting and for work. It is such a comfortable dress and it still very stylish. I love the pockets and you can layer it with a black denim jacket.
great work dress with a fun pattern - fits and flatters well try to size, if between sizes would size up or if your chest is larger than a D.
Size up one size and fit well. Material is thick and you don't need a slip under it. Slightly long for me, but still wearable.
I wore this to work a couple of times. It’s is a good fit and flattering. Great for the office on a hot day.

links_reviews_title: Bring the Animal to the Party
links_reviews_text: Super cute and flattering, classy silhouette. Only 4 stars because fabric is thick so less movement and felt a little stiff.

This dresses colors literally match a sunset. It's linen, which is super in right now, and it's just adorable on. The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is because it runs a bit big. The straps should be a bit tighter because the front drops down a bit too low on me, so I needed sticky tape to keep it from flashing my chest.

This dress is so pretty! My only issue is that, like many free people items, I’m not sure this baggier style looks good on my body type (size 8/10, wider hips) and made me feel a little like I was wearing a sack (but a beautiful sack!) I think this would be the perfect vacation dress though as it was really breezy.

links_reviews_title: Look amazing online, sucks in person
links_reviews_text: I might have gotten a bad batch/pair, but they were NOT two-toned. They literally just looked black and were soooo cropped. I am tall, but they looked ridiculous in the winter. I was really disappointed and would not recommend.

would be cute if i had ordered multiple sizes up. not true to size

I couldn't get these over my butt what a bummer

I loved these jeans, they were something fun for an outfit that was lacking. That being said, I wish the pant legs were a little closer to the image shown, in reality they are pretty close in tone. They are DEFINITELY running small. I sized up 1 size, and wish I would've sized up 2 times. Overall though, a great piece that wore in quickly!

links_reviews_title: Wanted to love but too small

links_reviews_title: So cute but did not fit
links_reviews_text: The length was too long (I’m 5’0/ 5’1 with shoes). It looked like highwater jeans on the model but it went past my heels. The thigh area was also quite baggy so it did not look flattering.

I really wanted to love these jeans!! They were too tight in the waist, despite the fact that I have other jeans in the same size (and even one size down) from this brand that fit. Gave me a upper muffin top basically. Also, the color between the two panels is almost indistinguishable. I was hoping for a more noticeable difference, like shown in the picture. I think other people could really enjoy these jeans though! Just maybe size up and don’t expect the two panels to look much different from each other.

links_reviews_title: So cute but a little snug!
links_reviews_text: I LOVE these jeans! They are a bit snug in the waist so I would definitely recommend sizing up- I am typically a 27 but ordered a 28 because I saw they run small. They were a little tight the first time I wore them but loosened up a bit after that.
super cute! ordered 3 sizes up from my usual size and they fit perfectly, so definitely runs small!
Cute but tight in all the places and they were already a size up from my normal size

I'm usually a 28 or 29 in jeans and sized up after I read the reviews. It fit in the waist but the legs were more of a boyfriend style because I had to order a larger size. Looked cute and got several compliments but I wish they fit like a true skinny jean and actually fit normally.
I should gotten a size or two larger. I typically wear a 28 in jeans, but these wouldn't go over my hips. If you are slim hipped, they might work for you.

These jeans were a total waste of a rent. They do not look like the picture AT ALL!! They are basically black jeans. I read the reviews so I sized up but then the jeans were actually too big. Really disappointed in these because they could be really cool.
I upsized because of past reviews, but they ended up way too big on me. They are also not as color contrasted as pictured. These are tricky, but maybe don’t over upsize? Good luck!
I like them a lot however my pear-shaped does not work with pants like this no matter how much I like that style
Size up a size or two. I liked them enough to buy them after the month

links_reviews_title: Very cute but cropped for tall people
links_reviews_text: Very cute , the two tone is pretty subtle. The only thing is that if you are tall these are pretty short. I’m 5’11 and they hit 3/4 down my calf, so def cropped. Still adorable though
I was so excited to get these jeans but the waist is sized for a 12 year old! couldn’t fit in them at all and I’m typically a 26...
Thought I would be a size 28 since I used to be a size 27 in BDG jeans but these were still too tight. Prob should’ve gotten a 29 :(

I got a lot of compliments but most of them being like "wait are the pant legs different colors? I almost wish they were even more contrasted I didn't even notice i love them!" Def run small, they were tight I got a 27 and I am a 26. Great pants to be able to try on and not fully buy though!

I wore these for a weekend trip with my girl friend. Love the way they looked with my cropped sweaters. I sized up to a 29 (usually a 28) based on the reviews. The only issue I had was sitting in the car, I had to unbutton.

links_reviews_title: Wanted to love them so badly!
links_reviews_text: It might've been that the size was too small for me personally, but they didn't fit and I was so sad about it. Was so excited to wear these :(

links_reviews_title: Go a size bigger, then never go home
links_reviews_text: These pants were the first item from Nuuly that I tried on and I instantly fell in love. Wasn't particularly familiar w/ the brand so I'm v glad I read the reviews and went up in sizing. Despite my athletic build, the jeans fit both my waist and my thighs (a rarity!). I'm writing this after only having worn them once but they're so versatile I can't wait to wear 'em again this weekend.

links_reviews_title: Order a size or two down!
links_reviews_text: Super cute but no stretch at all.... so so small. I have a lot of jeans this brand and am always a 25 but if I were to re get these I think I’d need a 27 at least. Thighs are very tight was well. Fit more like skinny jeans for sure

links_reviews_title: HEHE these are so much fun
links_reviews_text: i get a bunch of compliments every time i wear them. the 2 colors aren't as different as they are in the picture but still different!!! awesome pants

I completely fell in love with the look of these jeans. My normal BDG size is 30, but I ordered these in a 31. At first they were so small on me. I could zip and button them but they were super tight and uncomfortable. However, I tried to purposely stretch them by pulling very hard on the waisband and hip area while having them on. I have to say, they stretched a lot, to the point where they are now completely comfortable when standing up. Sitting down is still a bit uncomfortable, but not terrible. So moral of the story is that these do stretch a lot with wear, but I think most people writing the reviews did not get a chance to wear them because they were too small. Frankly I just think it's very hard to get the fit right with 100% cotton rigid jeans, which is what these are.
Should have checked. My normal size in bdg is 31. My favorite jeans are the girlfriend jeans and 31 suits me perfectly usually. I could not get these over my big butt! Size up! Maybe even two sizes!!

links_reviews_title: No stretch. Not the best for curves.
links_reviews_text: Super cute jeans but with my tiny waist and curvy hips I couldn’t get them on. If you typically do well with no stretch denim these will probably work on you.

Unfortunately never got to wear them :( I got my normal size, but was no where close to being able to button - way small and no flex in the waist for sure. But really cute! And a nice length/material.
No room for stretch. Very small. Too bad because they are super cute

I'm usually between a 25 and 26 in bottoms, but since these aren't "skinny" jeans, I decided to try the 25. I was able to get them on, but not zip or button (like, at all). So I'm going to size up and reorder these jeans in my next box! They are even cuter in person and I was so bummed they didn't fit.

I read the reviews before I ordered this and went up two sizes and these pants still did not fit. I usually like the jeans from Urban Outfitters but these are the worst fitting pair of pants I have ever tried on.

I ordered 2 sizes to big to make sure they weren't too tight and they were really cute oversized with a belt! The 2 tone color isn't as dramatic as the picture makes it look, pretty subtle color difference.

Really like these. Had to roll them up, but I usually do with my height unless they’re petite. The waist was very tight on me, but my hips and waist are almost the same size so that was also to be expected. Looked great as long as I didn’t eat a big meal!
Although it was clear that my waist could fit these jeans, it won't go past my thighs, because the jeans had no give. Wanted to like it!

links_reviews_title: Been wanting to try these for so long!
links_reviews_text: Super stoked that I can rent these and not own them! Adds great flare to an otherwise bland outfit.
They were more like a 25 or 26 i would say so definitely size up. they still are a good quality and way cute.
I had these last month and went for a 27 as I am usually a 26 and they were still snug so this month I got them in a 28 and they were perfect

I sized up 1-2 sizes than normal because the reviews said I ran small, turns out they run very small. also the color difference is not that distinct, you can still tell a bit though. still very cute I would love to have them longer!

links_reviews_title: Cute but runs really small, they didn't fit me at all despite this being typically my "looser" denim size
links_reviews_text: too small, couldn't wear

links_reviews_title: these babies are TIGHT! but very cute
links_reviews_text: Well, at first I couldn't button these, they were so tight. I am always a 25 in BDG, but figured I'd get a 26 since I saw these ran small. I should have gotten a 27. Regardless, I ended up finding a way to squeeze into them, and they stretched out the slightest bit throughout the month (or I lost a few lbs). They're cute and fun, just size up honestly 2 sizes, unless you have a tiny waist!

Luckily, I read the reviews about these jeans running small so I picked one size up from my normal waist and they fit me perfectly! Like perfectly snug, so definitely size up! The coloring of the jeans are NOT as contrasted as the photos online. They are still really cute but way more subtle in person. Think more of a light gray & darker gray (rather than black & light gray.) This was a little dissapointing because I wanted them to be more of a stand out piece. They also aren't a skinny jean like the photos make it seem, It was snug in the butt/waist area but as far as fitting wore more like a boyfriend jean. Still really cute! I wore them a few times but a different piece then expecting based on the photos.

I couldn’t wear these, like most people I am having a hard time finding the correct sizing. I listened to the reviews saying these were really tight. I tried the 33 (tag says W33?) and they were MASSIVE. Way way to big.. not sure what the W stands for either. I will maybe downsize but it seems like everyone is having difficulty with these pants that it would kind of be a waste of an item IMO. Either way the two toned is nice. I can’t really say much else because they were just to giant to even picture what they’d look like.

These jeans fit me so oddly! I have had good luck with BDG in the past, but these are super thick and stiff, absolutely ZERO stretch, extremely tiny around the waist, which I could barely button, and then super loose thighs. They looked extremely dorky on me. Bummed!

I got the size 30 last time and it was too small. So asked for a 33 and it was far too big. The label said W33. I’m not sure if that means wide?? I know it does in shoes. Or Women’s size. I can’t remember if the 30 had a W in the size name. Maybe third try will be a charm? These are soo cute. I wish I could get one that fits.
Love where it hit on the leg, great to show off shoes. Also hit great on the waist so I could wear with a crop top. Love!
These are super cute but fit a little funny. Glad I got to try them out!

Saw reviews that the sizing was small so I ordered up a size from what I typically wear...they were still a little snug...I really want to like these jeans so I will try going up one more size next month. They also do not have as harsh of a contrast between the two legs and definitely are not as dark

I like these jeans a lot but they're a strange cut. Usually jeans fit me tightly in the hip and thigh and are too loose in the waist - I had the opposite problem with these. The waist was so tiny I needed to use pliers to zip up the jeans, but they were roomy everywhere else. They also felt a little...crooked? Maybe it's because of the two tone construction but the zipper placket pulled to the right and didn't line up straight on my body. The rigid denim gave some over a few hours wearing them but the waist was still so tight and uncomfortable I didn't wear them again. Too bad because otherwise they're cute as hell.

links_reviews_title: Too Small Going to Try Again!
links_reviews_text: The duo-tone on this is rad. I was unsure as to my jean sizing for this and it’s generally inconsistent across brands, so I don’t fault Nuuly. Some trial and error is going to happen. I’m going to try getting it again bigger and hope I get a size that fits. For reference I got the size 30 and I usually wear a US 8 in pants. It was tight in the waist and thighs, by butt fit just fine, everything around it was too tight though.

links_reviews_title: They would be so cute if they fit...
links_reviews_text: I wanted to love these jeans so badly, but could tell immediately that they wouldn't before I even pulled them up all the way. I have about 4 or so other BDG high-rise jeans in the same size that fit perfectly, but for some reason these ones were so SO tight in the waist that I could barely get the button closed. They still fit normally in the calves and thighs though.
Not very flattering

I ordered a size down in this per other reviewers' recommendations, and so glad I did - it fit perfectly. I noticed it had already been safety-pinned, and that definitely helped with the fit (kind of looser in the chest area). It's such a pretty top and a great statement piece.

This top wasn't flattering at all like it appears in the photo. The clasp sits much higher than pictured and causes the top to billow so my top half just looked like a beige puff. The embroidery wasn't as pretty as it looked in person, either. Overall, I would say this top made me look frumpy, not hippie-sexy.

love the embroidery details and the look/feel of this shirt. this was my 2nd time renting and though the shirt has definitely a more "worn" look to it since I got in my first Nuuly box in August (aka is showing a little wear and tear from so many uses,) I still loved it. I paired this with high-waisted skinny jeans- both black and blue, but also with shorts (during summer) as well. The sleeves do not work the best under a jacket, but do fit if you need another layer. This top is super versatile and I wore it comfortably in August summer humid heat, as well as during the cold winter.

links_reviews_title: I got this for a second time that is how much I love it

Great with some high waisted jeans. Not at all as low cut as picture suggests. The only problem was the sleeves were a little too short and a little too wide. Otherwise would have purchased!

I found myself wearing this to work, when I'm running errands and out drinking with friends. It is a very versatile and comfortable piece that I never want to take off. Only precaution is that it runs a little cropped.
Was cute -- a little worn and cropped, but cute!

links_reviews_title: This fit awkward and the pattern wasn't really what I was expecting.

This was a really great and beautifully crafted piece. I loved everything about it except for the fact that my boobs didn't look so great in this. Other than that, I would of probably worn it more!
I got sooooo many compliments on this gorgeous comfy top. One friend even bought it. Love it.

I wore this around the house first to see how I liked it but the quality just wasn't my thing. The orangey-red was a pretty color and it did fit well but the material looks and feels a bit cheap.

It also wears at your real waist, so can create a little bit of that mom belly pooch (but don’t let that deter you-it’s def a compliment getter).
This is such a gorgeous skirt. Of all the pieces I received this month I love this skirt the most. It zips up so there is not a lot of give, it is a true small. Maybe even a little small for a small.
Love love love this skirt! Tons of compliments and I was really comfy in it. I stuck with a basic tank and cute nude shoes. Easy, but stylish!

The watercolor effect in this skirt is stunning. I wore it 3 times to work over the month and received compliments every time. I styled it with a white loose fitted silk blend ruffle top tucked in, also from Anthropologie.

Love this skirt! It’s beautiful, comfort, and easy to wear. It paired well with a lot in my closet and was easy to dress up or down. It wore it most often with a fun convo tee. I usually wear a 4 in a skirt of this style, but needed the 6.
I love this skirt!!! I'm considering buying it. It flows in just the right way, hits my hips perfectly, and can move from summer to fall style effortlessly.

The fit is weird. I am short, yes, but ordered the petite so didn't expect quite the difficulty in fit that I had. The crotch was down to my knees, the waist was down to my crotch. No amount of fabric tape or safety pinning could save it. I wore it, but only because I didn't bring a back up. It was cute and I loved it, I will order again, but at least one size smaller.

The thicker, sweater like material makes this a great cold weather jumpsuit. I wore it with a black T-shirt underneath. It ran very big though. The belt helped to cinch it in but I could have gone down a size.
This was a very thick fabric, very nice quality suit. It was a bit big in a few places but was very nice for work

Such a great jumpsuit! Fits true to size, has a nice amount of stretch to the material, and is soooo comfy and flattering. I wore it for a night out and got so many compliments on it. Throw a leather jacket on top and you're good to go.
What a great piece to wear to work and then go have a mocktail after. Fit: Comfortable Style: Versatile Fabric: Substantial I feel good!

I'm not tall, but my trunk is actually not petite. But with this piece, the crotch hung down 3-4" low. Couldn't wear it unfortunately. Love the style and the design. The fabric is HEAVY though. I don't think this is for summer wear. Which is why I thought it would be amazing for January wear both in NYC with a heavy sweater and in FL with a lighter cardigan. Alas I couldn't wear it.

This was such a cute jumpsuit! Yes it was a little tricky to get in and out of but not a deterrent. It was so soft and flattering. Lots of compliments - loved it!
